40#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
41# include "config.h"
42#endif
43
44#include <sys/cdefs.h>
45__RCSID("$NetBSD: pam_set_item.c,v 1.3 2017/05/06 19:50:10 christos Exp $");
46
47#include <sys/param.h>
48#include <sys/socket.h>
49
50#include <stdlib.h>
51#include <string.h>
52
53#include <security/pam_appl.h>
54
55#include "openpam_impl.h"
56
57/*
58 * XSSO 4.2.1
59 * XSSO 6 page 60
60 *
61 * Set authentication information
62 */
63
64int
65pam_set_item(pam_handle_t *pamh,
66 int item_type,
67 const void *item)
68{
69 void **slot;
70 size_t nsize, osize;
71
72 ENTERI(item_type);
73 slot = &pamh->item[item_type];
74 osize = nsize = 0;
75 switch (item_type) {
76 case PAM_SERVICE:
77 /* set once only, by pam_start() */
78 if (*slot != NULL && item != NULL)
79 RETURNC(PAM_BAD_ITEM);
80 /* FALLTHROUGH */
81 case PAM_USER:
82 case PAM_AUTHTOK:
83 case PAM_OLDAUTHTOK:
84 case PAM_TTY:
85 case PAM_RHOST:
86 case PAM_RUSER:
87 case PAM_USER_PROMPT:
88 case PAM_AUTHTOK_PROMPT:
89 case PAM_OLDAUTHTOK_PROMPT:
90 case PAM_HOST:
91 case PAM_NUSER:
92 if (*slot != NULL)
93 osize = strlen(*slot) + 1;
94 if (item != NULL)
95 nsize = strlen(item) + 1;
96 break;
97 case PAM_REPOSITORY:
98 osize = nsize = sizeof(struct pam_repository);
99 break;
100 case PAM_CONV:
101 osize = nsize = sizeof(struct pam_conv);
102 break;
103 case PAM_SOCKADDR:
104 osize = nsize = sizeof(struct sockaddr_storage);
105 break;
106 default:
107 RETURNC(PAM_BAD_ITEM);
108 }
109 if (*slot != NULL) {
110 memset(*slot, 0xd0, osize);
111 FREE(*slot);
112 }
113 if (item != NULL) {
114 if ((*slot = malloc(nsize)) == NULL)
115 RETURNC(PAM_BUF_ERR);
116 memcpy(*slot, item, nsize);
117 } else {
118 *slot = NULL;
119 }
120 RETURNC(PAM_SUCCESS);
121}
122
123/*
124 * Error codes:
125 *
126 * PAM_BAD_ITEM
127 * PAM_BUF_ERR
128 */
129
130/**
131 * The =pam_set_item function sets the item specified by the =item_type
132 * argument to a copy of the object pointed to by the =item argument.
133 * The item is stored in the PAM context specified by the =pamh argument.
134 * See =pam_get_item for a list of recognized item types.
135 */
136
